summary: This is a protective order filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York in case 1:15-cv-07433-RWS. The order establishes rules for handling confidential information in the civil lawsuit between the plaintiff and defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, restricting disclosure of sensitive discovery materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the civil lawsuit. The protective order is designed to protect confidential information implicating her privacy interests.

events.title: Protective Order Filed
events.description: The court enters a protective order in the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell to govern the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: United States District Court Southern District Of New York
keyFacts: A protective order was issued in the civil case (1:15-cv-07433-RWS) involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
The order defines 'CONFIDENTIAL' information as that which implicates the privacy interests of both the plaintiff and defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
The order restricts disclosure of confidential information to specific categories of people, including attorneys, parties, expert witnesses, the court, and deponents.
The document is filed under the signature of a U.S. District Judge, indicating it is an official court order.
The protective order outlines procedures for designating, objecting to, and ultimately returning or destroying confidential materials at the conclusion of the case.
